TABLE.NAME: local_ousearch_words
TABLE.COMMENT: Contains one entry for each known word.

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: Unfortunately this key is required in MySQL for the sequence, bit of a waste of an index really...

TABLE.NAME: local_ousearch_documents
TABLE.COMMENT: Contains one entry for each known document (potential search result).

FIELD.NAME: plugin
FIELD.COMMENT: Module or plug-in name e.g. mod/ouwiki, format/studycal

FIELD.NAME: courseid
FIELD.COMMENT: Course ID for documents within a course

FIELD.NAME: coursemoduleid
FIELD.COMMENT: Course-module ID for documents within a module

FIELD.NAME: groupid
FIELD.COMMENT: Group ID for documents within a group

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: Group ID for documents within a group

FIELD.NAME: stringref
FIELD.COMMENT: Arbitrary string reference to identify document (null if not needed)

FIELD.NAME: intref1
FIELD.COMMENT: Arbitrary int reference to identify document (null if not needed)

FIELD.NAME: intref2
FIELD.COMMENT: Arbitrary int reference to identify document (null if not needed)

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: Time (seconds since epoch) at which document was modified

FIELD.NAME: timeexpires
FIELD.COMMENT: Time (seconds since epoch) at which document should be checked for changes, or null for no checks

INDEX.NAME: courseid_coursemoduleid
INDEX.COMMENT: To allow search via course or course and module. (OK to have shared index because it isn't possible to search coursemodule without knowing course.)

INDEX.NAME: plugin
INDEX.COMMENT: So we can restrict search by plugin type.

TABLE.NAME: local_ousearch_occurrences
TABLE.COMMENT: One entry for each unique word in each document. This is the really huge table.
